name: ishlangu-iklwa (combined)
description: this is a replica of a 'paired' variant of the Kulu spear-and-shield, 'ishlangu and iklwa, this particular model is a medium-length spear attatched to a mantle on the inner-frame of the long, oblong, lacquer-wood shield. Although weighty, it has the benefit of having the reach of a spear and the protective qaulities of a shield it can be thrusted either with one or two hands making it an excellent duaeling weapon. Activate it to seperate the weapon making it accessible to various techniques.

name: ishlangu-iklwa (seperated)
description: This is a full replica of the kusarigama, this particurly model bares chains with flaired, bladed-edges and the weight is now a small mace-head with flaying-ridges. Rip and tear. Might want to wear some leather-gloves.
